review: I got this item so that my wife could watch some of streaming videos of shows posted by the network web sites. The intent was to cast from the browser tab. It is very laggy when you try this though. It is fine with youtube because the content is not being served by your computer but rather from the origin server. Tab casting basically mirrors the tab and you need 1) a fast machine and 2) a fast WiFi connection. My wife's laptop is not that slow, an Intel i5 CPU but I need to connect it to the 100Gb ethernet and that helps a little. The Google docs do warn about these limitations but I hope this will improve at some point because it is pretty useless at the moment for browser tab casting.

author: Brick Pollitt

review: It's an interesting device for sure, but if you have a smart TV already it offers nothing for you. If you don't it only adds Netflix, YouTube, Hulu, and Google TV/Movies to your TV and you have to control it all with a smartphone. That means there is a TON of lag...hit pause on your phone and it takes a second or two before it pauses. Doesn't sound bad but really annoying.It's also crashed netflix on my phone (Galaxy S3) a lot since it added the ChromeCast update to Netflix (yes, it uses your existing apps, just updates them).The price is right and it's nice and tiny so fits behind a wall mounted flat screen nicely but I'd suggest a Roku instead.

review: This is a great device! Easy to setup and easy to use! So easy in fact that I can move it around the apartment, from TV to TV, without any difficulty. Right now it's limited to Netflix and what you get from Google Play store but apps for Hulu and HBOGo (and more) are in the works.Also, you can mirror your Chrome browser through it - so anything you can play in Chrome, you can play on your TV. Sometimes there are glitches (for us, Amazon Prime doesn't play sound) but for the most part, this works like a charm!
